page.title: 02The Old Rectory, Epworth.
page.content: {The Old Rectory}was the home of the Wesleys and is situated in{Rectory {Street.}It was burned down in {1704,}rebuilt, then destroyed again in an arson attack in{1709.}John was nearly killed but his father saved him just in time.Since then it has been rebuilt and refurnished and on{June {29th 1957}it was officially opened to the public.People from all over the world attended the ceremony. Today ,as well as being a place of historic interest, it is used for small conferences and as a retreat for paying guests. Since its restoration many thousands of people have visited it making Epworth quite an important tourist town.
